actions.recommendation: Clinically you have a low weight, however still showing to be within a normal BMI range. With improved nutrition and supplementation, your overall muscle mass and body stores will increase.

Currently you report no concerning symptoms. If anything arises you can consult your family doctor/ GP. As you get older (>40 years), regular prostate screening can be done. This includes a PSA blood level (prostate screening marker).
There were a few areas that we identify as currently causing low energy levels & general fatigue. However these can definitely be improved and restored.
I recommend consulting a dietician to help you with your nutritional intake.
We also discussed the benefits of supplementing and replacing your Vitamin D and B12 levels.
